metadata.Title: CVE-2015-5341 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
mod_scorm in Moodle through 2.6.11, 2.7.x before 2.7.11, 2.8.x before2.8.9, and 2.9.x before 2.9.3 mishandles availability dates, which allowsremote authenticated users to bypass intended access restrictions and readSCORM contents via unspecified vectors.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-5341` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

moodle - 2.7.11+dfsg-2
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: moodle package in esm-apps/bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.7.11+dfsg-2').
